capsules_submitted.utterance: You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly "The Boy Who Lived", and it's incredible to think about what he went through at Hogwarts. I mean, can you imagine being famous in the wizarding world just because you survived a killing curse as a baby? It's no wonder he had to deal with so much pressure and scrutiny throughout his life.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's truly "the boy who lived" - a legend in his own right. I mean, can you imagine being famous for surviving a killing curse as a baby? It's almost too incredible to believe. But at the same time, it's also kind of sad that he had to go through all that trauma from such a young age.
